caption: Very friendly staff and fresh ingredients. Flavors just not there. The salted chips offer more flavor than any of their prepared food items. The buffalo chicken was extremely bland and tasted more like mayonnaise with a hint of blue cheese. No hot sauce or "Buffalo" flavor to be found really. Some salt, or marinating in apple cider vinegar, would've done great justice. The Jamaican Jerk is good, as the profile is there, but the flavors don't pop and aren't as intense as you would expect from any jerk dish. I also appreciate the diversity of ingredients to create complexity. The steak is the best so far. Flavorful and very tender. Could slightly benefit from more acidity such as marinating in a vinegar, but otherwise very good. The menu has potential. I think they're worth trying, and I would personally like to see improvements. Portions are great and make it worthwhile. Won't end lunch hungry.
From VA and love them street tacos! Delicious with quick and friendly service! Go check them out!

Peye's Place is open again. It's still a great spot to grab a quick lunch. It's the best spot to get a really delicious quick lunch.  The aromas that greet you as soon as you walk in the door will make you confused as to what to order. You'll want one of everything. I had the special -  stuffed poblano pepper with mango salsa today.  Words can't describe how happy this lunch made me today. As always service is very friendly and prompt. Thank you Pete's Place!!
Rock solid. Nice menu, fresh ingredients, and a friendly staff. A lot of their items are served with mango salsa and arugula. That alone is worth the price of admission (which is reasonable).
Hands down best breakfast sandwich hands down.  That bacon Egg and Cheese with Mayo is Life.
Pete’s food is absolutely delectable. I eat it on the table when ever I am able. Thanks Pete
Stuff peppers with jerk chicken and rice.. delicious! If I could I would eat here every day, twice a day.

This restaurant is great! We have had some really wonderful lunches including arugula caesar salad, soups, sandwiches. Everything on the menu is really terrific. High quality ingredients, prepared with lots of TLC. Prices are reasonable as well. Check it out! It's a great spot downtown.

This place is excellent! I got the Jamaica jerk chicken rice bowl and it was great. The large was more than enough and will go with a small next time. This is located inside the same building as the department of labor.
Coming in soon petes a great guy
Good food

Finally had a chance to order food here, and I really enjoyed it. I ordered the rice bowl (jerk) and the portion was huge. The jerk chicken is very spicy, and the mango salsa topping complimented the dish. My wife ordered the crab cakes(comes with 2). Crab cakes was ok, they would've been out of this world if it had more crab than stuffing. But the sauce was great. Next was the tacos (3), she had chicken (jerk), shrimp, and steak. All was very good and packed with filling. You can't go wrong when you use real corn tortilla shells. In all great place to get real food, when you don't want fast food.
Always amazing!!
Excellent tasty food made fast. An oasis in downtown Buffalo

Food is always prepared super fast and right in front of you. They offer some basics, and some amazing unique options. And they're always willing to customize anything for you. I can't believe it's just a little stand with the way the food tastes. Highly recommend.

It's a tiny stand in a building, but man, they are slinging out some good food! You can smell the yumminess the moment you open the building door.  Great food and extremely reasonable prices. He does a nice jerk seasoning, and it's a place every employee downtown should check out, especially if they're hoofing it to the Ellicott Square Building. It's right across the street!  His crab cakes are out of this world, his Rice Bowls with jerk chicken or shrimp... wow!  His chili is also fantastic, and to be able to add on a grilled cheese sandwich for $1 is simply top notch.  You get to watch the food bring prepped, and unlike some places, he takes cash and credit. I haven't been for breakfast sandwiches yet, but I heard they are phenomenal, and I don't have a single doubt about it.  Since it's just a part of the NYS Labor Department building, don't go in expecting a place to sit. You've got enough room to order and wait, but the food is SO worth taking back to your desk.
Own a barbershop around the corner and this spot is clutch for a quick lunch..fast and delicious, at a good price..can't ask for more than that!

Great food, prepared quickly and right in front of you. Pete has traditional breakfast and lunch items like eggs/bacon/toast and burgers, but is always adding new and creative dishes to his menu, like his chicken bowl - rice, queso fresco, micro greens, tender spicy chicken thighs and... get this... MANGO salsa. It is so good. Pete is laid back and interesting to listen to. You can tell he puts a lot of effort into his culinary creations but also the atmosphere, which is hard in an office building. Fast, fairly priced and delicious.
The breakfast offerings are delish and the prices a very reasonably for a downtown quick eats lunch spot
I have never had something from Pete's that I didn't love.  The pork rice bowl with that pineapple salsa is A+!
